meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in using computers.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a computernik and can fix any computer problem.
meanings.sent2: The computernik at the tech store helped me choose the right laptop.
meanings.sent3: The computernik tried to fix the coffee machine by typing on the keyboard.
meanings.sent4: She was a computernik wizard, casting spells with her mouse and keyboard.
meanings.sent5: The computernik's brain was like a supercharged computer, processing information at lightning speed.

meanings.definition: To operate or work with a computer.
meanings.sent1: I will computernik the new software to see if it works properly.
meanings.sent2: She likes to computernik late into the night, designing new programs.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to computernik on the keyboard, creating chaos on the screen.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced across the keys as he computerniked his way through the coding challenge.
meanings.sent5: The students will computernik on the computers to complete their assignments.

meanings.sent1: The computernik industry is constantly evolving with new technologies.
meanings.sent2: She bought a computernik book to learn more about programming.
meanings.sent3: The computernik cat knocked over the monitor, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a computernik maze, filled with endless lines of code.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the hum of computernik equipment, creating a futuristic atmosphere.
